business.headline: Government in talks with insurers for climate-linked insurance scheme: ReportIndia ranks among the most climate-exposed nations, and to address this, the government has started talks with insurers to build a nationwide climate-linked insurance plan.

Sensex, Nifty continue positive run as banking stocks fuel rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 582.95 points to settle at 81,790.12, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 183.40 points to finish above the 25,000 mark.

Diwali 2025: Here's why not every gift you receive is tax-free, says expertWhile exchanging gifts is the highlight of Diwali, some presents may surprise you at tax time. Here's what an expert says about taxable gifts this festive season.
US pharma major Eli Lilly to invest $1 billion in HyderabadThe company will work with local contract manufacturers and set up a new Manufacturing and Quality hub in Hyderabad to oversee production.

Tata Capital IPO: Check latest subscription status, GMP and moreAnalysts have mixed views on the offering. While Tata Capital's strong financials and growth prospects make it appealing for long-term investors, some caution that provisioning for non-performing assets and changes in the company's loan mix may pose risks.

Renault may cut 3,000 jobs worldwide amid global market pressures: ReportFacing slower growth in Europe and increasing competition from rivals, Renault is reportedly planning cuts to its workforce, which could affect around 3,000 employees worldwide.

Sensex jumps over 500 points: Why is the stock market rising today?After a flat opening, the rally on Dalal Street gained momentum as banking, IT, and healthcare stocks led the charge, supported by robust corporate results and steady economic growth.

Canara Robeco IPO opens on October 9: Check price band, other key detailsThe Canara Robeco IPO is entirely an Offer for Sale, with 4.98 crore shares being sold at a price band of Rs 253 to Rs 266 per share.

Why cyber insurance has become a must-have for individuals in IndiaFrom UPI payments to social media, our lives are increasingly online. With cybercrime on the rise, personal cyber insurance is no longer optional—it's a must-have shield.

Bitcoin hits all-time high. Can the rally last?Bitcoin has surged to a new all-time high, crossing $125,000, sparking excitement among investors worldwide. With institutional demand and strong ETF inflows driving the rally, the question remains, can this momentum continue?

GST 2.0 cuts aren't reaching most Indian consumers, finds surveyMost Indian consumers are not seeing the benefits of GST 2.0. Despite tax cuts on essentials and aspirational goods, delayed price updates and supply chain gaps keep savings from reaching buyers.

Gold prices at record high. Should you buy now or wait?Gold has hit a fresh record high, leaving buyers unsure whether to make a move now or wait for a price dip. With festive demand and global uncertainty pushing rates up sharply, the big question is — is this the right time to buy?

Tata Capital IPO opens: Check GMP, key details, and should you apply or skip?The price band has been set at Rs 310 to Rs 326 per share, with a lot size of 46 shares. This means retail investors need a minimum of Rs 14,260 to participate.

Hospital stocks rise after CGHS rate revision. Should you buy?Hospital stocks are in focus today after the government announced the biggest revision in Central Government Health Scheme package rates in 15 years. The new rates, covering nearly 2,000 medical procedures, will come into effect from October 13, 2025.
Sensex, Nifty see muted start; Tata Capital IPO in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 44.18 points to 81,251.35 around 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 18.45 points higher at 24,923.

SIP vs RD: Where should your monthly savings go?Would you rather sleep peacefully or grow wealthy quietly? That's essentially what the SIP vs RD debate boils down to. Both allow disciplined monthly investing, but one protects capital while the other builds it. So which one deserves your money?

Man flags extra charge on cash-on-delivery payments, Centre launches probeThe Department of Consumer Affairs has launched an investigation into e-commerce sites charging additional fees on cash-on-delivery payments.

Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs is a sorry tale of grease of doing business in IndiaChennai-based logistics company Wintrack has ceased Indian operations, alleging repeated bribery demands and harassment by Chennai Customs, exposing the ugly truth that at Indian Customs integrity is the real contraband.

entertainment.headline: Raghav Juyal finds The Paradise with Nani after Aryan Khan's Ba***ds of Bollywood Raghav Juyal becomes the latest cast member in 'The Paradise', starring Nani. The film will release in eight languages on March 26, 2026.

Taylor Swift releases stunning video for new hit The Fate of Ophelia Taylor Swift has unveiled her latest music video 'The Fate of Ophelia' from her new album 'The Life of a Showgirl', blending various eras and iconic styles in a visually captivating narrative. The video premiered exclusively in theatres before its global online release.

Prabhas's The Raja Saab team heads to Europe to film final song, wrap filming 'The Raja Saab', featuring actor Prabhas, has entered the last phase of filming. The team is expected to shoot two key song sequences in Europe before wrapping up the main production.

Rajinikanth visits Badrinath Dham, offers prayers ahead of portal closure for winter Actor Rajinikanth visited Badrinath Dham and offered prayers on Monday. The temple committee welcomed him with a prasad and tulsi garland.

Channing Tatum says actors are incentivised to accept subpar productions for money Actor Channing Tatum openly criticised the current film industry's focus on subpar movies. He stated that streaming services have disrupted Hollywood, creating confusion but also opportunities for change.

Dhruv Vikram reintroduces himself, says he considers Bison his first film Dhruv Vikram reintroduced himself by calling 'Bison: Kaalamaadan' his first film even though he's two-films old in Tamil cinema. The sports drama directed by Mari Selvaraj releases on October 17 and aims to inspire audiences.

Ahaan Panday-Sharvari to star in Ali Abbas Zafar's romantic action drama: Report Sharvari has been cast opposite Ahaan Panday in Ali Abbas Zafar's upcoming untitled action romance, marking the filmmaker's fifth collaboration with Aditya Chopra.

Ram Charan's Peddi faces delay, likely to wrap by January 2026 | Exclusive Ram Charan's film 'Peddi' is facing a delay with the shoot extended to January 2026. The film's production and grand sets have pushed the timeline, impacting other projects.

Ranveer Singh shares spotlight with Adrien Brody, Victoria Justice at NBA Abu Dhabi Ranveer Singh made a dazzling appearance courtside at the NBA Pre-Season Game in Abu Dhabi, charming international stars and fans alike with his vibrant energy and stylish look. He was seen posing for pictures with Adrien Brody, Badshah, Rashid Khan and Victoria Justice.

The Ed Gein Story X reviews: Charlie Hunnam's crime show gets polarised reactions Actor Charlie Hunnam's 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story' was released on October 3, 2025. The Netflix series based on America's most notorious criminal opened to mixed reviews from audiences.

Alisha Chinai explains why she reunited with Anu Malik after sexual harassment case Singer Alisha Chinai has recalled her 1996 accusation of sexual harassment against Anu Malik and the industry's reaction. She has spoken about her initial isolation in the music industry following her complaint, and revealed why she decided to work with Malik again after he apologised.

Jared Leto says Tron: Ares release is perfectly timed amid AI conversation Actor Jared Leto stated that his upcoming film 'Tron: Ares' is releasing at a perfect time amid growing discussions about Artificial Intelligence. The film raises important questions about AI ethics and its impact on society.

Rise and Fall: Dhanashree Verma's team defends her amid trolling and harsh remarks Dhanashree Verma's team, amidst online trolling following comments by Nikki Tamboli, has responded with heartfelt messages highlighting her resilience and the support of her mother.

BB19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Malti Chahar enters as wildcard, Salman teases no elimination The 'Bigg Boss 19' Weekend Ka Vaar episode featured Salman Khan hosting fun games, celebrity appearances by Deepak Chahar and Elvish Yadav, and new wildcard entry Malti Chahar. The episode also saw housemate tensions, playful tasks, and a fake elimination twist.

BJP leader Annamalai praises Kantara Chapter 1 for craftsmanship, cultural depth Tamil Nadu BJP leader K Annamalai has joined the chorus of praise for Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1', calling it a powerful blend of faith and folklore that honours tradition and craftsmanship.

Pankaj Kapur defends depiction of toxic masculinity in Shahid Kapoor's Kabir Singh Pankaj Kapur spoke on the criticism of Shahid Kapoor's role in 'Kabir Singh'. He shared thoughts on the actor's growth as an actor and family dynamics. The veteran actor highlighted the importance of generational perspectives.

Not an easy job: Amitabh Bachchan urges women to take pride in being homemakers Amitabh Bachchan urged women to speak proudly about being homemakers, highlighting the challenges of managing a household.

Diddy verdict a cautionary reminder to young individuals with dreams: Aubrey O'Day Singer and reality TV star Aubrey O'Day states in an X post why Sean 'Diddy' Combs' 50-month prison sentence serves as a real warning to aspiring individuals

Aahana Kumra calls Arbaaz Patel the most hated contestant in Rise and Fall Actor Aahana Kumra shared her tough experiences on the reality show 'Rise and Fall'. She revealed how therapy and personal growth helped her overcome bullying and harsh judgements.

general news.headline: Bihar to vote on November 6, 11, results on 14th Live updatesThe first phase is to be held on November 6 while the second phase will be held on November 11, CEC Gyanesh Kumar declared.

Live: Bihar elections in 2 phases; bypolls to 8 assembly seats on November 11Bihar Election Date Announcement Live: The Election Commission announced the schedule for the Bihar Assembly elections. The term of the 243-member state assembly ends on November 22.

Doesn't affect me: CJI Gavai rules out action after lawyer tries to throw shoe at himThe police immediately detained the accused lawyer, while Chief Justice Gavai remained composed and continued the proceedings without interruption.

Nobel in medicine awarded for work on understanding intricacies of immune systemTheir pioneering work on peripheral immune tolerance revealed how a special class of immune cells, known as regulatory T cells, act as guardians against autoimmune disease.

Is Nitish Kumar the Sleepy Joe of Bihar?Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who has, at least for the last two years, shown signs of fatigue and confusion publicly, is facing the Opposition's attacks over his health. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav and Jan Suraaj's Prashant Kishor's have called him "clueless and ill". Will Nitish, who has now been branded the "Joe Biden of Bihar" for his gaffes, manage to survive the pre-poll heat and secure a 10th term? Or will he be forced to drop out like Biden?

Always so f***ing negative: Trump told Netanyahu to 'take the win' on Gaza planBenjamin Netanyahu dismissed Hamas's response to the Gaza peace plan as insignificant. This prompted Donald Trump to snap back and say, "I don't know why you're always so f***ing negative. This is a win. Take it."

Pak ships first batch of rare earths to US, sparks outrage over secret dealsPakistan has dispatched its first shipment of rare earth minerals to the US under a $500-million deal with an American company. The Imran Khan-led PTI has raised concerns over the secrecy of the agreements, demanding full disclosure. Critics fear such deals undermine Pakistan's sovereignty and national interest.

On Camera: BJP MP Khagen Murmu bleeds after locals attack him with stonesBJP MP Khagen Murmu and MLA Shankar Ghosh were attacked by locals in West Bengal's Nagrakata while they were visiting a flood-hit area.

Yes, Meghan, now we're talking…Meghan Markle arrived at the Balenciaga show at Paris Fashion Week to support designer Pierpaolo Piccioli on Saturday, and through her dramatic ensemble, she made the world take notice of her once again.

BJP leader Annamalai praises Kantara Chapter 1 for craftsmanship, cultural depthTamil Nadu BJP leader K Annamalai has joined the chorus of praise for Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1', calling it a powerful blend of faith and folklore that honours tradition and craftsmanship.
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Why do Desi apps often fail and what does it say about future of Arattai?Arattai messaging app is all the rage nowadays. It is not the first Indian app that has caught the fancy of social media chatter. And it won't be the last. But like Hike, Koo, and others, this one too will find it difficult to sustain its momentum.

Alisha Chinai explains why she reunited with Anu Malik after sexual harassment caseSinger Alisha Chinai has recalled her 1996 accusation of sexual harassment against Anu Malik and the industry's reaction. She has spoken about her initial isolation in the music industry following her complaint, and revealed why she decided to work with Malik again after he apologised.

Why is a doctor responsible? Medical body questions clean chit to cough syrup makerThe Indian Medical Association has objected to the arrest of a doctor linked to the ongoing cough syrup controversy, sources said. They have also questioned the reason behind the clean chit given to the alleged cough syrup-making company.

In Bihar's bipolar landscape, Prashant Kishor injects delicious irony and uncertaintyPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj shakes Bihar's entrenched caste-cash politics, leveraging youth anger and digital outreach. Amid welfare-driven loyalty, will PK emerge as a vote splitter, kingmaker, or king?

Will bury India under debris of its own warplanes, says Pak Defence MinisterPakistani Defence Minister Khawaja Asif warned India of severe consequences, following comments from Indian Army chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi about erasing Pakistan from the world map if it failed to stop terrorism on its soil.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 4: Rs 300 crore in sight, biggest Kannada openerRishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' is set to cross Rs 300 crore at the box office after a strong four-day run. The film has become the third highest grossing Kannada movie, challenging previous records.
How IIM Ahmedabad defies placement trendsWith Rs 35 lakh average salary for the business management and Rs 20 lakh for agribusiness graduates, IIMA's placement holds steady amid global headwinds.

Can scapegoating doctors ever end India's deadly cough syrup tragedies?Sixteen children are dead. A doctor is in jail. The toxic cough syrup came sealed and approved, but it's the prescriber, not the producer, who is paying the price. Once again, India shields pharma and scapegoats its doctors.
The bigger games behind Munir's Pasni offerIs Asim Munir laying the foundation of a bigger US-funded CPEC passing through Pakistan's southern flanks and into Central Asia?

These places to witness supermoon as it rises in the skies tonightThe first supermoon of 2025 will rise shortly after sunset, making it an excellent time for skywatchers to enjoy this spectacular lunar event.

Gone in 27 days: French PM Sebastien Lecornu quits month after Macron appoints himFrance slipped into further political deadlock as Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu, appointed by President Emmanuel Macron nearly a month ago, quit, a day after his largely unchanged cabinet he unveiled drew furore among right-wing allies.

Hikaru throws away Gukesh's king: Was it drama or disrespect?World No.2 Hikaru Nakamura stoked controversy after beating India's D Gukesh in USA's Checkmate tournament. After his win, Hikaru picked up Gukesh's king and threw it into the crowd. Was it disrespectful, or was the drama done to grab eyeballs?

Brahmins ignite flame of knowledge in society: Rekha Gupta's remarks spark rowDelhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta praised the Brahmin community for igniting the flame of knowledge in society, leading to sharp criticism from AAP, who called her comments insensitive.

sports.headline: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli need domestic cricket to play 2027 WC: Irfan Pathan Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli aim for the 2027 ODI World Cup, but match fitness remains their biggest challenge. Irfan Pathan urges domestic cricket to maintain game readiness, keeping hopes alive for fans worldwide.

Indian players to feature in sixth edition of Lankan Premier League The Lanka Premier League's sixth edition, beginning December 1, will feature Indian players for the first time, with 24 matches across three venues.

No crowd for Tests, but 24,000 watch India A vs Australia A ODI in Nagpur India A vs Australia A has drawn 24,000 people in Kanpur. In sharp contrast, the Test match between India and West Indies saw barely any crowd in Ahmedabad.

India urged to fix batting issues after Pakistan win before tougher World Cup games Former India batter Anjum Chopra has called on India to not overvalue their dominant win over Pakistan in the Women's World Cup, warning that unresolved issues, particularly in the batting department, could cost them against stronger teams like South Africa, New Zealand, and Australia. Chopra and skipper Harmanpreet Kaur both highlighted the importance of addressing inconsistencies before facing tougher opponents.

NZ vs SA Live: Devine leads NZ's counter-attack New Zealand (NZ) vs South Africa (SA) Women's World Cup Live: Sophie Devine is up and running as New Zealand look to counter-attack after their early blows to help them set the platfgorm for a competitive total against South Africa.

I don't like attitude, arrogance: Mohammed Siraj on staying grounded after fame Mohammed Siraj reflected on his outlook on life after rising to fame as one of India's premier fast bowlers. The Hyderabad pacer said he has stayed grounded and has not forgotten his humble beginnings.

After his win, Hikaru picked up Gukesh's king and threw it into the crowd. Was it disrespectful, or was the drama done to grab eyeballs?

Barcelona did not know what to do with the ball: Pedri after Sevilla thrashing FC Barcelona fell to their first loss in the LaLiga on Sunday. Sevilla thrashed Barcelona 4-1 to hand them their biggest loss of the season so far.

Path-breaking as captain, Rohit Sharma enters his final act: Can he do a Dhoni? Rohit Sharma's era as India's captain may be over, but his influence is far from finished. As mentor and elder statesman, he can shape the next generation, guide Shubman Gill, and ensure his fearless, path-breaking philosophy endures in the lead-up to the 2027 ODI World Cup.

Wouldn't be surprised if Shubman Gill becomes India's T20I captain too: Panesar Former England spinner Monty Panesar praised Shubman Gill's appointment as India's next ODI captain and added that he wouldn't be surprised if the star opener were also handed the T20I captaincy.

Pakistan break silence on Muneeba Ali's controversial run-out vs India Pakistan pacer Diana Baig refrained from adding more fuel to the fire over opening batter Muneeba Ali's controversial run-out against India in the sixth match of the Women's World Cup 2025 at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo on Sunday.

Navdeep Singh roars as India finish with record medal haul in World Para ChampsOne of India's favourite javelin throwers - Navdeep roared again at the JLN Stadium on Sunday, as the clinched the silver medal in F41 category. With 4 medals on the final day of the competition, India finished with their best ever medal tally.

3rd T20I: Saif Hassan helps Bangladesh complete series sweep over AfghanistanBangladesh completed a commanding 3-0 clean sweep over Afghanistan in the T20I series in Sharjah, successfully executing their chase in all three matches.

Focus on bowling, not on India-Pakistan talk: Kranti reveals her success mantraIndia's newest pace sensation Kranti Gaud revealed that she remains unfazed by the hype surrounding the India-Pakistan rivalry, saying her focus is solely on her bowling. The young pacer starred with a match-winning spell as India defeated Pakistan by 88 runs in their ICC Women's World Cup clash in Colombo.

Unable to even walk due to cramps, Jannik Sinner retires from Shanghai MastersWorld No.2 Jannik Sinner limped off the court in the third round of the Shanghai Masters. Sinner, facing intense cramps, had to be carried out by his physio.

Women's World Cup: Dodgy India need to tighten up despite dream startIndia are sitting atop the Women's World Cup table, but poor DRS decisions, sloppy catching, and inconsistent batting highlight cracks that could cost them against stronger teams like Australia and England.

Can't dwell on one performance, it's a long tournament: Sinalo JaftaSouth Africa wicketkeeper batter Sinalo Jafta said that their team will not dwell too much on the opening match horror against England as they have a long tournament ahead. The Proteas women will next take on New Zealand in their second fixture in Indore.

IND-A vs AUS-A: Prabhsimran hundred helps India A win 3rd ODI and claim seriesPrabhsimran Singh's blazing hundred and fifties from Shreyas Iyer and Riyan Parag helped India close out a thrilling win against Australia A to win the 3rd ODI and claim the series 2-1 on Sunday, October 5.

Want to win World Cup for pioneers of Indian women's cricket: Jemimah RodriguesIndia women's cricket team continues their unbeaten streak with a dominant win over Pakistan. The squad aims to honour past pioneers by winning the 2025 Women's World Cup.

Women's World Cup: Dodgy India need to tighten up despite dream startIndia are sitting atop the Women's World Cup table, but poor DRS decisions, sloppy catching, and inconsistent batting highlight cracks that could cost them against stronger teams like Australia and England.

The Proteas women will next take on New Zealand in their second fixture in Indore.

Want to win World Cup for pioneers of Indian women's cricket: Jemimah RodriguesIndia women's cricket team continues their unbeaten streak with a dominant win over Pakistan. The squad aims to honour past pioneers by winning the 2025 Women's World Cup.

World Cup: Village watches on giant LED screen as Kranti Goud shines against PakistanKranti Goud was thrilled with her performance against Pakistan and said that her family had installed a big LED screen to watch the game on Sunday, October 5. Goud picked up three wickets to help India beat Pakistan comprehensively.

Pakistan captain Fatima Sana sprays pest control in IND vs PAK clash, video goes viralWomen's World Cup: Fatima Sana sprayed pest control to tackle a fly infestation during the clash against India. She also starred with the ball after taking two wickets.

12-0: India dismantle Pakistan in Colombo to extend dominance, top tableWomen's World Cup 2025, INDW vs PAKW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India extended their dominance over Pakistan with a thumping 88-run win over their arch-rivals on Sunday, October 5 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

After England horror, South Africa confident of bouncing back vs New ZealandSouth Africa aim to recover after a heavy defeat in their Women's World Cup 2025 opener against England. The Proteas women got all out for 69 and suffered a ten-wicket defeat in their first fixture.

No replacing Sophie Devine, every opposition fears the way she plays: Suzie BatesSuzie Bates has said that no one can replace Sophie Devine in the New Zealand team and claimed that every team fears the all-rounder for the way she plays the game. Devine is set to retire from ODIs after the completion of the World Cup.

AIFF name India's 23-man squad for AFC Asian Cup qualifiers in SingaporeIndia has finalised a 23-member squad for the AFC Asian Cup 2027 qualifiers against Singapore. The Blue Tigers face a must-win challenge to keep qualification hopes alive in Group C.

Watch: Hikaru Nakamura throws D Gukesh's king into the crowd after Checkmate winWorld No.2 Hikaru Nakamura courted controversy during the Checkmate tournament as he threw D Gukesh's king after beating him in the match on Saturday, October 4. India were soundly beaten by the USA on the day.

Singapore GP: Mercedes' George Russell takes win, McLaren take constructors' titleGeorge Russell claims victory at the Singapore Grand Prix while McLaren clinches the Formula 1 constructors' title, and despite the tensions after Norris and Piastri made contact in a challenging, heat-affected race.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
